instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message:
Hi, I have a 3115 that doesnt get an orange light. Green light is present but seems to blink a little. No liquid damage after checking with Microscope.

Voltages measure as follows:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>:  Moving between 16.2 and 16.8v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.54 - 12.57
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: On <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> Swinging from 3 - 3.42v on pin 4 stable on pin 5
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 4.97
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.29
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>: 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>:  0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.45v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>: pin 17/18 and pin 27/28 , 3.5ohm and 20 ohm, 

Resistors <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>/7011/7010/7051/7052/7021/7022 all OK (accept <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> measures 0 but also on a working board i guess its an error in the schematics which mentions 30.1k).

Suggestions?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message:
Without a recognized battery the light will not turn orange on these.

Was this a liquid spill?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message: Hi Duke, no no obvious liquid spill checked it with microscope, SMC area clean too. With battery connected it also stays green with a little blink

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message: Since you say [I]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0v [/I]I am guessing this is dead. Since you mention <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> jumping back and forth I imagine the charger is being shut off due to a short circuit up ahead. What is the resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>/the rest? My guess is short circuit to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message:
I checked following lines and didnt find short to ground yet:

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>:  0.629
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.450
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.363
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.523
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.157
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>: 0.411
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>:  0.145
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.423

On a working board I get 

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>:  0.633
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.446
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.353
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.514
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.132
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>: 0.376
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>:  0.142
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.489

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> pulsing. Check carefully, hard to catch the short pulses on multimeter, best to use a scope with "one time trigger" activated.
